description: Townsend Harris (October 4, 1804 â€“ February 25, 1878) was a successful New York City merchant and minor politician, and the first United States Consul General to Japan. He negotiated the "Harris Treaty" between the US and Japan and is credited as the diplomat who first opened Shogunate Japan to foreign trade and culture in the Edo period. [Source: Wikipedia]
name: Townsend Harris
